edu.blackburn.cs.cs212.restaurantbase

Class Money

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.blackburn.cs.cs212.restaurantbase.Money

  • public class Money
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds an amount of Money for a given Currency; uses a default of US Dollars if no currency is passed in. Money is immutable; to do math, use the add() and subtract() methods.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Money ONEDOLLAR
      For convenience, an instance of Money of $1

    • Constructor Detail

      • Money

        public Money(Currency currency,
             double amount)
        Constructor to take a currency and an amount
        Parameters:
        currency - the specific currency for the amount of money
        amount - as a double; converted and stored internally as a long which is shifted two places; ensures no partial cents

      • Money

        public Money(double amount)
        Special constructor that assumes the currency to be US dollars Hint: USE THIS ONE
        Parameters:
        amount - as a double; converted and stored internally as a long which is shifted two places; ensures no partial cents

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrency

        public Currency getCurrency()
        Get the currency for the Money
        Returns:
        the currency

      • getAmount

        public double getAmount()
        Get the amount for the Money
        Returns:
        the amount, converted to a double; should never have more than two decimal places

      • getAmountString

        public java.lang.String getAmountString()
        Get the amount converted to a String to extend to exactly two decimal places
        Returns:
        the amount as a forced two-decimal string, e.g. 1.00

      • sameCurrency

        public boolean sameCurrency(Money compare)
        Determines if another Money object uses the same currency
        Parameters:
        compare - the Money to compare this Money to
        Returns:
        true if the currencies are the same

      • add

        public Money add(Money add)
        Add one Money to this Money and return as a new Money
        Parameters:
        add - a Money to add
        Returns:
        a new Money that represents the sum of this Money and the Money passed in

      • subtract

        public Money subtract(Money subtract)
        Subtract a Money from this Money and return as a new Money
        Parameters:
        subtract - a Money to subtract FROM this Money
        Returns:
        a new Money that represents the difference the Money passed in subtracted FROM this Money

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Get the Money formatted with the symbol and value with two decimal places
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
